newsitem.title: USA: IMF approves second loan tranche for Jordan.
newsitem.headline: IMF approves second loan tranche for Jordan.

text.p: The International Monetary Fund on Wednesday released $60 million for Jordan, the second tranche in a $295 million loan to help finance a controversial belt-tightening program agreed to in February.
The program, designed in part to reduce budget deficits, included a doubling of the price of bread, an action that sparked some of the worse unrest in the kingdom in seven years.
"Jordan continues to make impressive progress under its structural adjustment and reform program," the IMF said in a statement.
It said the reforms are being supported by sound fiscal and monetary policies and the maintenance of the current exchange rate.

The statement also said the Jordanian authorities had "strengthened social safety nets to assist the poor and compensate vulnerable segments of the population adversely affected by the adjustment and reform measures."
